sub_subject.name: Digital Art, Photography & Media Production
sub_subject.description: 13-year academic progression (K-12) for Digital Art, Photography & Media Production (Fine Arts)

objectives.objective_text: Identify a flipbook.
Identify the frame rate (speed).
Identify what the character is holding.
Identify black outlines.
Identify the 'Undo' button as a way to fix mistakes.
Identify the paint bucket tool.
Identify 'My work' vs. 'Someone else's work'.
Name the creator.
Identify the Copyright symbol Â©.
Identify a bar chart.
Identify the 'Next' button.

Recall that we color carefully.

Recall that stealing is wrong.
Recall that taller bars mean 'more'.
Observe a weather chart.

objectives.objective_text: Observe file icons.

Color the character's clothes.

Explain how shape language shows personality (round=nice, sharp=mean).
Explain the 'Thumbnails' phase of ideation.
Defend the 'Form follows Function' rule in biological design.

Color inside the lines.

Use a separate layer for color.

Defend the stylistic choice of inking style.

Explain resolution (DPI) before starting a canvas.
Defend the ergonomic importance of posture and grip.
Change the size of the brush.
Pick a color from the rainbow wheel.

Defend the use of non-destructive editing layers.

Explain the difference between a Stroke (outline) and Fill.
Align objects to the center.

Ask permission to use a picture.

Defend the right to intellectual property.

Use bullet points.
